Such an outstanding game. Far exceeded my expectations when I picked it up back in v1.2.

Unlike previous Arma titles, this one is created as a whole game in its own right - it's no longer just a sandbox dev environment where you rely on good modders to make otherwise VERY uninteresting gameplay enjoyable.  The Enfusion engine is incredibly impressive, the variety of detailed mechanics that immerse you in gameplay makes Reforger stand out. 

It's a really authentic title with none of the predatory practices that other games have. It stays true to the setting, you won't find any details that are out of place for the period of the game. No female spec ops warriors, no garish skins, no pointless bloat in equipment variety. It's a show-not-tell environment with very little HUD for the most part. It's also a milsim that so often feels like a survival game, making it incredibly unique amongst its kind.

Patch 1.6 has really turned the game into a better team environment and a much deeper game where players can carve out very specific and creative play styles depending on what their preference is. There is now a meaningful economic strategy to develop with supply scarcity. You can be securing supplies as a logi driver, knowing you're doing something that's vital beyond just the early game these days. You can take it sideways instead: scavenge the battlefield looting high value enemy gear to return to your arsenal. Or you can hit the battlefield with a truck to reclaim resources from abandoned or destroyed vehicles.

If you're me, you love engineering. This is in part running supplies, but it's mainly taking up the commander's objectives to build bases or setting up FOB infrastructure. Or building impenetrable sandbag + wire fortresses. However, you can take this sideways too: you can head out to lay AT or AP minefields - defensively or offensively. Or perhaps you head out to clear obstructions for your logistics teams. Or you go out there and create those obstructions for the enemy with roadblocks and ambushes.

There are much finer inter and intra squad mechanics to master too. It now means more to survive, which means working together with your squad. With the greater division of duties via squad types, you're also going to be rewarded when you start working with other squad types to get stuff done. Engineers need offensive squads to clear areas to establish bases for example. Mortar teams can burn down enemy supplies until they have to respawn elsewhere, making it much easier for your assault teams to move in.

It's overwhelming at first, but once you get a grip of it you will come to appreciate just how much more there is to offer in the game as a result of patch 1.6.

Further to that, so many of the most absolutely frustrating elements of Reforger have been patched out: no more RPG-7 spam; no more RPG sniping; no more gamma abusing for night vision exploits; free-form base locations give much needed variety to the gameplay after all this time; being forced to very limited loadouts to begin with means you're relying on other players to give you a variety of attack options; no more assault rifle + UBGL + Sniper + C4 main characters roaming around never wanting to work together in any meaningful way.

If you're looking for a run'n'gun kind of game that you can farm Tiktok clips that no one will watch, then Reforger is no longer really that game. Its pacing is now slowed down to what anyone who is wanting to play a milsim is expecting. But it's still very much a sandbox. 

My only big complaints that remain in the vanilla game at the moment are:
-Movement and other action speeds are MUCH too fast. Apparently something is in the works, but this needs to have been changed already in my opinion. 
-Nametags (particularly xray squadmate names) are far too much, far too cluttering and diminish some really enjoyable aspects the game had in v1.4 (the fog of war between squad mates, the gameplay of communicating and co-ordinating).
-Low detail distance rendering making it much easier to see people amongst thick grass and trees at long range.

Arma Reforger mixes stunning visuals with deep tactical gameplay, creating a truly immersive sandbox. The pacing is slower and more thoughtful, rewarding players who communicate and plan together. It can be demanding, both technically and skill-wise, but the sense of accomplishment is unmatched. It’s a unique experience for anyone who enjoys realism and teamwork.

ABSOLUTELY AMAZING WAR SIMULATION GAME ! - One of My Favorite Games!

Summary: This game delivers the core, immersive military simulation experience you crave, backed by a massive community and the incredible visual power of the Enfusion engine. The quality of the core gameplay, combined with the endless customization, makes this an easy recommendation for anyone looking for the next-level tactical shooter.

Graphics & Immersion (Superb Graphics & Immersive Gameplay):
The switch to the Enfusion engine has been a game-changer. The graphics are truly superb, with environments that feel incredibly detailed and alive. The visual upgrades support the high level of immersion the Arma series is known for. Every firefight, every tactical movement, and every drive across the map feels authentic and grounds you completely in the Cold War sandbox setting.

Gameplay & Multiplayer (Awesome Gameplay & Incredible Multiplayer Gameplay):
The core military simulation gameplay is awesome and unmatched in its strategic depth. This is not a casual shooter; it demands teamwork and careful decision-making. The incredible multiplayer gameplay is where Reforger truly shines. Whether you're coordinating supply runs or engaging in massive combined arms battles in Conflict mode, the experience of working with your squad against another player-led faction is intense, tactical, and highly rewarding.

Community & Longevity (Loads of Mods & Loads of Custom Servers):
The community support here is amazing. The game already boasts Loads of Mods via the Workshop, allowing you to completely shape your experience, from new weapons and vehicles to entirely new scenarios. Thanks to the Loads of Custom Servers, you'll always find a match running exactly the kind of scenario you want, ensuring the game's longevity is practically limitless.

Verdict:
Either your a casual FPS gamer or Hardcore FPS gamer Arma Reforger is, without a doubt, one of the best FPS game on the market. It is the definitive military sandbox and a powerful precursor to Arma 4. If you want a game that offers realistic, expansive, and constantly evolving tactical multiplayer, jump in now.

The main gamemode on official servers being a battlefield style conquest is pretty cool. But it can be hard to just jump in and play, play with friends, or even just find a good fight. But where this game really shines is when you host a server, or play solo, and really enjoy a classic Arma experience. The new engine is amazing, the graphics are improved, new vehicle and weapon interactions are smooth, and everything is just further refined from previous installments. Plus the cold war theme is awesome, a welcome change from vietnam/ww2/middle east. This game has provided some of my favorite Arma experiences to date. Can't wait for more epic updates/mods to this (the new island from a recent update is awesome), and it makes me hyped for Arma 4.

First few hours in a game, you're having fun. Especially, when you're with friends: planning tactics, supply routes, helping each other with their own strategies. After a couple hours, you get into this groove of knowing what your team needs, what you can provide, but you mostly stay for the hopes of the game ending in either way. 
To either see the result of your effort, and or, see your stats which aknowledge said effort.
Thus comes my review, two aspects of the conclussion of the game can get frustrating:
1. the end game timer is put at 15 minutes, which although better than the previous 5, is a bit too much, and the game turns into a standstill, until at best it ends in one team giving up and the other using the chance to end it. Rather than it being a swift finish.
2. the game has a tendency, especially towards the end of matches of crashing. Plus side is, your rank and loadouts get saved. Minus- your stats reset. Which may be a small thing, but it gets rid of a part of the vissible effort, your own contribution from being visible. And game crashes are inevitable, so if there's a chance to implement match stat saving, that'd be great.

Alright, Bohemia, let's talk. After 15 hours with the new Arma Reforger 1.6, I can confidently say you’ve managed to patch the fun straight out of the game and replace it with a tedious, unbalanced slog.

The new Kolguyev map is a masterpiece of art design and a catastrophe of game design. As someone who appreciates depressing Soviet bloc architecture, the attention to detail is amazing. But as a player, it’s a concrete NASCAR track. The entire meta is now a demolition derby of jeeps and UAZs hugging the coastline, while everyone else tries to summit Mount Boring in the middle.

Why the sudden need for speed? Because the new loadout system is a masterclass in unintended consequences. To stop players from draining supplies, you introduced limits so restrictive that no one can afford a long-range radio. The result? Every man for himself, buying his own damn jeep to get to the action. This isn’t a team game anymore; it’s Mad Max with more bushes.

And the radios! Limiting them to three uses isn't a balance change; it's a joke. You might as well delete them from the game. The old system was elegant: more supplies, more respawns. Simple. Now, the grind to Major gets you a loadout that feels like you’re a broke private. The new meta isn't tactics; it’s looting your dead teammates just to get a decent kit. This is Escape from Tarkov, but your friends are the loot pinatas.

As for the Commander role? I wouldn't touch it with a ten-foot pole. Instead of leading a charge, the CO is now a glorified FedEx driver, chasing down braindead AI convoys stuck on a roadblocks. Meanwhile, the grunts are looting the last of the supplies to join the coastal Grand Prix.

Remember Arma II? You got burned by this exact "Warfare" approach before DayZ accidentally saved your company by reminding everyone that games should be fun. Reforger was a blast - dynamic and engaging. Now you’re turning it into a sterile training simulator for Jarheads who hate joy. Why?

I’m uninstalling until this mess gets sorted. The fun is gone.

My Patch Notes for Your Patch Notes:
- Bring back the FUN. The last version had it; this one is just a chore.
- Ditch the radio paywall. Tie respawns back to supplies. It just worked.
- Fix the loadout limits. A Major should feel like a badass.
- Scrap the AI convoys. They're glorified piñatas on wheels. Let players run logistics for XP.
- Add a longer cooldown on vehicle purchases.
- Nerf the partisan aimbots. This isn't a 20-minute hike simulator just to get headshot.
- Give the base AI a brain. Right now, they’re just chickens waiting to be plucked by the first enemy that shows up.
- Just bring back the last patch, at least for Everon. You were so close to greatness.

1,000 Hours In and The 1.6 Update Finally Drove Me Away.

I’ve put about 1,000 hours into Arma Reforger, but this 1.6 update has completely killed my enjoyment of the game. The new game mode and squad-based roles have stripped away what made Reforger fun, freedom, and flexibility. Now it feels like a cheap knockoff of Squad, or as I like to call it, Temu Squad.
I used to love being able to approach objectives and gameplay however I wanted, but now everything feels forced and boxed in. I’m told how I have to play, where I have to spawn, and what role I have to fill. It’s frustrating, restrictive, and the opposite of what Arma has always stood for and feels like a job now.
To make things worse, the performance somehow got even worse with this update  stutters, desync, and drops everywhere. After all the time I’ve invested, this patch is the first one that’s actually made me uninstall the game.
Arma Reforger 1.6 didn’t just change the game. It changed the experience into something I no longer recognize or want to play.

There is a bit to be said about this game. I will start by stating that I have been playing ArmA ever since it was Operation Flashpoint, and I have played every single ArmA game since. I have recently just got back into ArmA via this Reforger game. 

I do like the return to the Cold War era, it is simple and focuses on tactics and team work more than weapon superiority. The game naturally encourages team work, with sections forming out of mutual intent to secure the same series of objectives rather than by forcing it. So it is refreshing to have a game where team work is mostly used.

That said, there are some critical failings in the game itself. Firstly, it runs horribly. I have a Core i5 13600K and a Asus Strix (massive cooler on them things) 4070Ti. Unlike other games where I can run them with a ±3 FPS tolorence (within standard game play), Reforger's FPS is all over the place; even to the point where I can increase or reduce the graphics settings, but that only changes the GPU usage percentage and doesnt actually change the FPS stuttering. And before you think it is the mods, I make this judgement both with and without any mods installed. Although I am on a PC, I think that the devs really need to get their stuff sorted and enhance the playability for console users - seems they have opened this game to consoles as well. My opinion on performance is based upon my use of RivaTuner to monitor my CPU, GPU, and RAM, so there are no system limitations at play when I say that the stuttering is horrible. 

The second issue I have is from the recent update (1.6) where specific items and weapons become locked out depending on what soldier class you have selected. In my opinion, this is contrary to the historical vibes of ArmA where you take what ever it is that you need to ensure mission success, and you find a like minded group of lads and set forth as your own section. This class-based system is not desirable at all, it is appears to be trying to minic the class-based system of other games.

Overall I actually do recommend this game - but, I cannot recommend this game to what might be the majority of the buyers which might be using console or older PCs that will struggle beyond the point it is worth the effort. I will absolutly be happy to change this review if at a minimum the performance problems are fixed.

Currently, the servers are really underperforming. I would strongly suggest implementing a matchmaking system for solo players or small groups of up to four. Matchmaking works much better in these cases, especially since most servers either lack enough players or suffer from poor connection quality. Of course, server creation should still be available for communities with large player bases.

Additionally, the reward and punishment system needs improvement, and the game’s mechanics should be made more cohesive. At the moment, players can constantly friendly-fire, harass, or mock others without meaningful consequences. This makes the multiplayer experience frustrating rather than enjoyable. Team play is nearly impossible unless you’re already part of a dedicated community.

Please continue working on this aspect of the game. As a solo player, I’m not enjoying the multiplayer modes at all, even though the solo experience is awesome and genuinely fun.
